TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Compiler extends System.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The recommended alternative is Microsoft.CSharp.CSharpCodeProvider and System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeCompiler. The CSharpCodeProvider and CodeDom ICodeCompiler provide a much richer set of functionality for specifying how to launch the compiler.")

Docs.summary:
**NOTE: This API is now obsolete.** The non-obsolete alternative is [CSharpCodeProvider](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/tteyf242\(v=vs.90\)).
Managed wrapper for the C\# compiler.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To compile C\# code in-process, call <xref:M:Microsoft.CSharp.Compiler.Compile(System.String[],System.String[],System.String,System.String[],System.Collections.IDictionary)>.

Docs.threadsafe: Any public static (Shared in Visual Basic) members of this type are thread safe. Any instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.CSharp.CompilerError[] Compile (string[] sourceTexts, string[] sourceTextNames, string target, string[] imports, System.Collections.IDictionary options);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.CSharp.CompilerError[] Compile(string[] sourceTexts, string[] sourceTextNames, string target, string[] imports, class System.Collections.IDictionary options) cil managed
Public Shared Function Compile (sourceTexts As String(), sourceTextNames As String(), target As String, imports As String(), options As IDictionary) As CompilerError()

public: static cli::array <Microsoft::CSharp::CompilerError ^> ^ Compile(cli::array <System::String ^> ^ sourceTexts, cli::array <System::String ^> ^ sourceTextNames, System::String ^ target, cli::array <System::String ^> ^ imports, System::Collections::IDictionary ^ options);
static member Compile : string[] * string[] * string * string[] * System.Collections.IDictionary -> Microsoft.CSharp.CompilerError[]

Docs.param:
Type: array<[System.String](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/s1wwdcbf\(v=vs.90\))\[\]
An array of type string, each with C\# code.

Type: array<[System.String](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/s1wwdcbf\(v=vs.90\))\[\]
An array of type string that contains the file names for each sourceTexts.
The output file name. This argument is required.

Type: array<[System.String](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/s1wwdcbf\(v=vs.90\))\[\]
An array of type string, with files to reference.
Docs.summary: Compiles the given C\# sources to the specified destination file.
Docs.returns: Type: array<\[\] Returns diagnostic messages as an array of type . If the array is empty or all elements are warnings, the compilation succeeded.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each string in the sourceTexts parameter is the equivalent of a single source file. There must be at least one sourceTexts element. The file names in the sourceTextNames parameter are used for compiler diagnostics and debug information. The array is required, but it can be locally overridden by use of the \#line directive. The array must have the same number of elements as the sourceTexts parameter. The imports parameter is the same as the /reference compiler option. This parameter can be nulla null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). For the options parameter, the key is the short form of the compiler option. The value is the value desired for the option. The options parameter can be nulla null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). Some compiler options are not recognized. Recognized options and value:

Key Name

Usage

addmodule

List of modules to include in this assembly. The module names must be separated by the vertical bar or pipe character. Value must be of type String. See /addmodule (Import Metadata) (C# Compiler Options).

baseaddress

Base address for libraries. Value must be of type UInt32. See /baseaddress (Specify Base Address of DLL) (C# Compiler Options).

bugreport

Produces bug report file. Value must be of type String. See /bugreport (Report a Problem) (C# Compiler Options).

checked

Set default expression evaluation to checked (or unchecked). Value must be of type Boolean. See /checked (Check Integer Arithmetic) (C# Compiler Options).

d

List of semicolon separated symbols to define. Value must be of type String. See /define (Preprocessor Definition) (C# Compiler Options).

debug

Emit debug information with output. Value must be of type Boolean. Full or pdb-only cannot be specified. See /debug (Emit Debugging Information) (C# Compiler Options).

doc

File name to put XML comments in. Value must be of type String. See /doc (Process Documentation Comments) (C# Compiler Options).

filealign

PE section alignment size. Value must be of type UInt32. See /filealign (Specify Section Alignment) (C# Compiler Options).

incr

Enable incremental rebuild. Value must be of type Boolean.

lib

Additional paths to search when locating modules and referenced assemblies. Value must be of type String. See /lib (Specify Assembly Reference Locations) (C# Compiler Options).

linkres

Link a managed resource to the assembly. Value must be of type String. See /linkresource (Link to .NET Framework Resource) (C# Compiler Options).

m

Type to search in for the Main method. Value must be of type String. See /main (Specify Location of Main Method) (C# Compiler Options).

nostdlib

Do not auto-reference mscorlib.dll. Value must be of type Boolean. See /nostdlib (Do Not Import Standard Library) (C# Compiler Options).

nowarn

List of semicolon separated warning numbers to not report. Value must be of type String. See /nowarn (Suppress Specified Warnings) (C# Compiler Options).

o

Enable compiler optimizations. Value must be of type Boolean. See /optimize (Enable/Disable Optimizations) (C# Compiler Options).

r

Referenced assemblies. Value must be of type String. If more than one assembly is specified, the file name must be separated by the vertical bar or pipe character. See /reference (Import Metadata) (C# Compiler Options).

res

Embed a managed resource. Value must be of type String. See /resource (Embed Resource File to Output) (C# Compiler Options).

target

Output file target type, one of the following: "library", "exe", "winexe", or "module". Value must be of type String. See /target (Specify Output File Format) (C# Compiler Options).

unsafe

Allow unsafe constructs. Value must be of type Boolean. See /unsafe (Enable Unsafe Mode) (C# Compiler Options).

w

Warning level (0-4). Value must be of type String. See /warn (Specify Warning Level) (C# Compiler Options).

warnaserror

Report warning diagnostics as errors. Value must be of type Boolean. See /warnaserror (Treat Warnings as Errors) (C# Compiler Options).

win32icon

Win32 icon for auto generated Win32 resource. Value must be of type String. See /win32icon (Import an .ico File) (C# Compiler Options).

win32res

Win32 resource file. Value must be of type String. See /win32res (Import a Win32 Resource File) (C# Compiler Options).
